intro: Tetrabaculum, commonly known as the four-leaf clover, is a plant species that belongs to the Velloziaceae family. It is characterized by its unique leaves, which often have four lobes, giving it its common name. The plant is native to South America and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its succulent leaves store water, allowing it to survive in harsh conditions. Tetrabaculum is also notable for its small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or green.
